comment: **Note: the ModECI MDF specification is still in development! Subject to change without (much) notice. See [here](https://github.com/ModECI/MDF/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Aspecification) for ongoing discussions.**

Model.definition: The top level Model containing _Graph_s consisting of _Node_s connected via _Edge_s.

format.description: Information on the version of MDF used in this file

generating_application.description: Information on what application generated/saved this file

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

graphs.description: The list of _Graph_s in this Model

Graph.definition: A directed graph consisting of _Node_s connected via _Edge_s.

parameters.description: Dict of global parameters for the Graph

conditions.description: The _ConditionSet_ for scheduling of the Graph

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

ConditionSet.definition: Specifies the non-default pattern of execution of _Node_s

termination.description: The _Condition_s that indicate when model execution ends

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

Node.definition: A self contained unit of evaluation receiving input from other Nodes on _InputPort_s. The values from these are processed via a number of Functions and one or more final values are calculated on the _OutputPort_s

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

output_ports.description: The _OutputPort_s containing evaluated quantities from the Node

InputPort.definition: The InputPort is an attribute of a _Node_ which allows external information to be input to the _Node_

shape.description: The shape of the variable (note: there is limited support for this so far...)

type.description: The type of the variable (note: there is limited support for this so far

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

Function.definition: A single value which is evaluated as a function of values on _InputPort_s and other Functions

function.description: Which of the in-build MDF functions (linear etc.) this uses

args.description: Dictionary of values for each of the arguments for the Function, e.g. if the in-build function is linear(slope), the args here could be {"slope":3} or {"slope":"input_port_0 + 2"}

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

Parameter.definition: A Parameter of the _Node_, which can have a specific value (a constant or a string expression referencing other Parameters), be evaluated by an inbuilt function with args, or change from a default_initial_value with a time_derivative

default_initial_value.description: The initial value of the parameter

value.description: The next value of the parameter, in terms of the inputs, functions and PREVIOUS parameter values

time_derivative.description: How the parameter with time, i.e. ds/dt. Units of time are seconds.

function.description: Which of the in-build MDF functions (linear etc.) this uses

args.description: Dictionary of values for each of the arguments for the function of the parameter, e.g. if the in-build function is linear(slope), the args here could be {"slope":3} or {"slope":"input_port_0 + 2"}

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

OutputPort.definition: The OutputPort is an attribute of a _Node_ which exports information to another _Node_ connected by an _Edge_

value.description: The value of the OutputPort in terms of the _InputPort_ and _Function_ values

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element

Edge.definition: An Edge is an attribute of a _Graph_ that transmits computational results from a sender's _OutputPort_ to a receiver's _InputPort_

parameters.description: Dict of parameters for the Edge

sender.description: The id of the _Node_ which is the source of the Edge

receiver.description: The id of the _Node_ which is the target of the Edge

sender_port.description: The id of the _OutputPort_ on the sender _Node_, whose value should be sent to the receiver_port

receiver_port.description: The id of the _InputPort_ on the receiver _Node_

metadata.description: Dict of metadata for the model element
